pr_title: Add table type support to the new parser.

timeline.message: Recovery logic for table type descriptor.
Changed the parsing logic of table type descriptor.
Test cases for table type desc

timeline.bodyText:
I think we don't need a context for this one. parseTypeDescriptor  inside parseTypeParameter() does that.
Unlike in L#8069, for this one TYPE_DESC_IN_ANGLE_BRACKETS is OK, since the table-type ends after this.
timeline.author: SupunS

timeline.bodyText:
We may have to give a different context to the parseTypeParameter method. Inside that method, by default, a TYPE_DESC_IN_ANGLE_BRACKETS is started. (Lemme call it FOO for now)
The problem with TYPE_DESC_IN_ANGLE_BRACKETS is, it assumes the immediate > is the end of the type desc. But for table, it is not the end.
timeline.author: SupunS

timeline.bodyText:
An alternative way is to give an alias to < as use it here. For example say row-type-param-start as the next context.
Then inside the getNextRule() method, for the row-type-param-start, we can give the FOO (which i mentioned earlier) as the next-rule.
timeline.author: SupunS

timeline.bodyText: Similar to LT, if we can give an alias to >, we can avoid the complication inside getNextRuleForGt
timeline.author: SupunS

timeline.message: Changed recovery logic of table type desc.
